Package monsterfighter.ui

Interface GameEnvironmentUi

All Known Implementing Classes:
CmdLineUi, Gui
public interface GameEnvironmentUi
Defines a user interface (UI) for a GameEnvironment. Class adapted from the RocketManagerUI class in the seng201 RocketManager example project.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    DAY_REQUIREMENTS
    A description of the day requirements for a game of Monster Fighter
    static final String
    MONSTER_NAME_REQUIREMENTS
    A description of the naming convention for a Monster's nickname
    static final String
    NAME_REGEX
    A regex for validating the name against the specified name requirements.
    static final String
    NAME_REQUIREMENTS
    A description of the naming convention for the Player's name
    static final String
    NICKNAME_REGEX
    A regex for validating the monster nickname name against the specified name requirements.

  • Method Details

    • setup

      void setup(GameEnvironment gameEnvironment)
      Initialises this UI and sets up the given GameEnvironment with the available monsters and items. Note that setup need not be complete by the time this method returns. Once setup is complete this UI must call GameEnvironment.onSetupFinished(String, int, Monster, String, monsterfighter.core.GameEnvironment.Difficulty). Method adapted from the seng201 rocket manager example project.
      Parameters:
      gameEnvironment - The game environment that this UI interacts with

    • start

      void start()
      Starts this UI allowing the user to play Monster Fighter. Method adapted from the seng201 rocket manager example project.

    • confirmQuit

      boolean confirmQuit()
      Confirms that the user really wants to quit. Method adapted from the seng201 rocket manager example project.
      Returns:
      true if the user wants to quit, false otherwise

    • quit

      void quit()
      Quits the application. Method adapted from the seng201 rocket manager example project.

    • showError

      void showError(String error)
      Reports the given error to the user. Method adapted from the seng201 rocket manager example project.
      Parameters:
      error - The error to display
